Position: Business Analyst, Plano TX Job Type: Full-time Salary: DOE Job Summary: Manage the relationship between the business units and customer stakeholders/Project managers, ensure business objectives are being met by defining requirements to address short and long term solutions, and validate changes in business processes are implemented well and quality field level training is completed. From a support perspective, it is expected that research will be conducted on reported or assigned incidents with interim and permanent solutions implemented or recommended as system changes. Responsibilities: Other duties may be assigned. A teammate in this position must have the ability to: Manage the relationship between the business units and designated account managers. Be responsible for the elicitation of business requirements and subsequent creation of a business requirements document. Ensure changes, updates and exceptions are documented throughout the project life cycle. Work under the supervision of Senior Business Analyst when learning new areas of focus within the company. Create work flows, swim lanes, mock screens or screens and other visual aids to demonstrate how the solution should be created. Collaborate with development and SME’s to establish the vision of a project and analyze the tradeoffs between usability and performance needs. Prepare cost benefit analysis and ROI research to ensure projects submitted are providing proper returns to the company. Obtain approval of the business requirements documents from the business within the project timeline. Provide weekly status reporting to ensure everyone included in the project has an understanding of major milestones, timelines, and whether assigned projects are on track to meeting expected delivery dates. Create adhoc or snapshot reports to aid the business by providing information and working to define long-term solutions where needed. Develop training material as well as maintenance of existing material so business users have an understanding of the systems and solutions that are in place. Facilitate of meetings as needed. Required Experience and Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, business management or equivalent industry experience as a Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst Strong analysis, organizational, oral and written communication skills. Ability to work on many different assignments at one time with demonstrated follow through, attention to detail and commitment to customer service. Ability to work in stressful situations where time demands are high and have the ability to discern priorities. Strong business acumen Ability to travel to divisions to support in upgrades, new implementations, creation or opening of new divisions. Project Management Certification (or in process of obtaining) If interested, apply by sending your resumes to venky@ ceofoundry.com. Real Estate Valuation Analyst - Invesco - job post Altus Group 142 reviews Dallas, TX Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Job Category: Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group! Altus Group is currently looking for a new Real Estate Valuation Analyst. This position is dedicated to client services and is located in the Dallas offices of Invesco Real Estate. In this position, you will be responsible for all financial analysis for every property within the client portfolios assigned to the analyst. Specific analyses include valuation, asset management, disposition, lease and historical performance analysis. Other responsibilities include the assisting asset management and portfolio management with the external appraisal process and ad hoc analysis. Group Description: The Valuations Group performs all financial analysis for Invesco Real Estate’s US direct real estate portfolio, valued at over $31 billion. The group performs the processes for establishing fair market values for the underlying assets through third party appraisals and internal valuations. These valuations are required for financial reporting, client reporting, and performance benchmarking. The primary property types include office, retail, industrial, and multi-family. The independent group is tasked with the execution of a process designed to value assets with as much objectivity as possible. An important part of the function is to balance the competing perspectives of investment professionals involved in the internal processes to ensure that supportable data is the primary consideration in deriving unbiased valuations. This work is necessary for all of the Advisor’s product lines including open end funds, closed end value add funds, closed end strategic opportunistic funds, an open-end debt fund, and separate account clients. Understanding the structure and investment premises of these funds and their underlying assets will be critical to providing quality work. Key Responsibilities: Perform financial modeling such as discounted cash flow for unleveraged structures. Coordinate with all levels of management to gather and analyze data, summarize findings, and prepare recommendations regarding conclusions. Facilitate the third-party appraisal process as directed by client requirements, including reviewing and auditing the appraisals and writing review comments with market support for findings. Present valuation analyses and assumptions to senior members of asset management and portfolio management. Other duties as assigned. Position Requirements: BA or BS required in Finance, Real Estate, Accounting or Economics, or an area with real estate related coursework Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in the financial analysis of commercial real estate investments and/or appraisal services Intermediate Argus and Excel skills preferred Self-motivated, team oriented and strong time management skills to prioritize deadlines Excellent organizational, interpersonal, oral and written communication skills is essential Must have general grasp of understanding the inputs and outputs of a property-level cash flow Come realize your potential at Altus Group! We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Applicants with disabilities may contact Altus Group to request and arrange for accommodations. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time. Please contact us at accessibilityusa@altusgroup.com or . (416) 641-9500

Asset Protection Analyst - job post Essilor of America, Inc. 668 reviews Dallas, TX 75234 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Luxottica is a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of fashion, luxury and sports eyewear. Our wholesale network covers more than 150 countries and our retail presence consists of over 9,100 retail stores across the globe. In North America, our wholesale business is the home to global brands like Ray-Ban, Oakley, and many of the top fashion house brands. Our leading retail brands include; LensCrafters, Sunglass Hut, Pearle Vision, and Target Optical. We are also home to EyeMed, the fastest growing vision care company in the United States. Supporting over 4,500 retail stores in North America, a career in our retail headquarters allows us to stay in touch with the end customer and use their ever-changing behaviors and preferences to shape our offerings of the best eyewear and services. GENERAL FUNCTION The Asset Protection (AP) Analyst has the main role of collection and analysis of Point of Sale (POS) and business data for Luxottica Retail. The process includes defining rules within Exception Based Reporting System, SAP knowledge, and familiarity with POS Systems. The AP Analyst will be responsible for collaboration and communication with Brand and Shared Services partners. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Review and analyze data within Exception Reporting System and other databases to identify, detect and develop System generated findings. Discover new areas of risk/fraud within Exception Reporting System and improve the logic within existing areas of the System. Manage the relationship with Brand and Shared Services partners and oversee the use of the Exception Reporting System. Respond to end user support requests with high quality, speed, and accuracy. Use of data to support recommendations for Brand and Shared Services partners in solving business problems. Analyze business reports related to theft/fraud to determine AP Field involvement. Partner with the AP Field team to investigate as needed. Analysis of inventory results and inventory movements to provide insights. Provide Monthly/YTD Statistics on investigations, audits, training, and restitution for department leadership. Assist with projects and programs, as needed. Administrative Duties, as needed. BASIC QUALIFICATIONS Database administration experience Strong data visualization / storytelling capabilities Knowledge of Exception Based Reporting, SAP, Business Objects and Advanced Excel skills Knowledge of retail business risks and analysis Effective communication skills, both verbal and written Ability to work independently and exercise sound judgment 1+ years’ experience with systems, preferably exception-based systems College Degree in Business Administration, Statistics, or Business Analytics Upon request and consistent with applicable laws, Luxottica will provide reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities who need assistance in the application and hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call the Luxottica Ethics Compliance Hotline at 1-888-887-3348 (be sure to provide your name and contact information so that we may follow up in a timely manner). We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, national origin, social origin, social condition, being perceived as a victim of domestic violence, sexual aggression or stalking, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship, ancestry, veteran or military status, marital status, pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy or maternity leave), genetic information or any other characteristics protected by law. Compensation and Benefits Analyst - job post EnLink Midstream 108 reviews Dallas, TX 75201 Full-time Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Overview: EnLink Midstream is a leading provider of midstream energy services, providing transportation, gathering, processing, and storage of crude, natural gas, and natural gas liquids, products necessary to power our communities and lives. Strategic and forward-looking, EnLink cultivates a high level of employee values while we plan for future growth and participate in the energy transition through exciting new projects involving carbon capture and sequestration and other innovations redefining the industry. At EnLink, we are positioning ourselves to be the future of midstream by leading in innovation and creating sustainable value. The foundation of EnLink’s strength comes from enabling our businesses to grow in an environment of trust, cooperation, and collaboration. EnLink promotes a diverse workplace, as well as opportunities for learning and career development. Join a company where employees are the strongest link! Responsibilities: This individual will support the Human Resources (HR) team with compensation, benefit and general HR projects and programs. This individual will work closely with their counterparts to coordinate and execute companywide HR strategies and provide general HR support as needed. The individual selected for this position must be an excellent communicator and a collaborative team member. They should be a self-starter with the ability to effectively influence and communicate, build strong relationships, and become a trusted advisor. Compensation: Participate in salary surveys, audits and studies of compensation practices and develop recommendations for compensation changes needed to ensure competitive practices. Assist with annual merit, STI and LTI cycle including system administration, leadership communication and training, and analysis of compensation submissions for executive approval. Manage company position management in PeopleSoft and annual headcount planning and budget process with leadership. Benefits: Support annual Open Enrollment process and assist with day to day benefit questions or analysis. Update and organize EnLink’s Intranet Human Resources pages. Manage dependent verification process and evidence of insurability (EOI) for Life Insurance. Manage EnLink’s Healthy Incentive Program – Company wellness program. Assist with developing and presenting benefit education and marketing materials. General Duties: Manage the HR team budget and company benefit budget including annual planning and monthly variance reporting. Review and approve employee information in PeopleSoft ensuring accuracy. Manage EnLink’s electronic personnel file system ensuring all personnel files are compliant and complete. Update and organize EnLink’s Intranet Human Resources pages. Provide project management and analytical support to the execution of the Total Rewards strategy. Participate and may take the lead in cross-functional team projects as appropriate, support ad hoc project/analysis requests, and perform other duties as required. Sr Analyst Pricing Strategy and Analytics - job post JCPenney 25,656 reviews Plano, TX 75024 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time Sr Analyst of Pricing Strategy and Analytics will support business objectives and company initiatives for pricing strategies, analytics, and implementation. Responsible for working closely with the Business units to develop, implement, and execute pricing strategies supporting both the strategy and profitability needs of the company. Creates and maintains everyday price positioning guidelines as well as analytical solutions and ad hoc analysis to support growing needs of the business. Daily responsibilities will vary, being flexible and adaptable based on the needs of the individual business and Senior Pricing Manager. Primary Responsibilities: Gather requirements and goals for quantitative and statistical analysis, models and tests decisions and outcomes, and understand desired outcome of analytics Compile data needed to solve business questions using insights, and analytics to deliver better business outcomes Analyze tests to find tactics that maximize revenues and/or profit for the enterprise Support Sr Pricing Manager and the business unit, managing their specific pricing portfolio Build relationships with key business partners including Marketing and Store Execution to support the Pricing functions Partner with pricing analytics to gather insights and help guide the business units to business driving pricing decisions Participate in Business unit pre-season pricing strategy meetings, informing pricing decisions Support and build presentations, communicate data points, and assist in delivery in pre-season strategy Connect pricing initiatives by channel, assisting in price congruency, inventory needs, and execution across the stores and site. Core Competencies & Accomplishments: Bachelor's degree 2+ years Merchandising, P&A, Project/Change Management experience Strong problem-solving skills, analytical skills and communication skills required 1-2 years of experience in hands on data querying and reporting work Strong understanding of key retail performance indicators Advanced Microsoft Excel and Access skills; ability to analyze data in order to identify and quantify business opportunities What you get: We offer a competitive benefits package including medical/dental/vision, term life insurance, paid vacation/holidays, 401(k) Savings Plan with company match, and an associate discount on JCPenney merchandise. About JCPenney: JCPenney is the shopping destination for diverse, working American families. With inclusivity at its core, the Company’s product assortment meets customers’ everyday needs and helps them commemorate every special occasion with style, quality and value. JCPenney offers a broad portfolio of fashion, apparel, home, beauty and jewelry from national and private brands and provides personal services including salon, portrait and optical. The Company and its 50,000 associates worldwide serve customers where, when and how they want to shop – from jcp.com to more than 650 stores in the U.S. and Puerto Rico. In 2022, JCPenney celebrates 120 years as an iconic American brand by continuing its legacy of connecting with customers through shopping and community engagement. Please visit JCPenney’s Newsroom to learn more and follow JCPenney on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and LinkedIn. For more opportunities to join our team please visit our careers page.

Behavior Analyst - job post Centre For Neuro Skills 127 reviews Irving, TX 75063 Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Job Type Full-time The Behavior Analyst develops and monitors individual behavior treatment programs for the clinic, residential and extended care patients. Work is full time during the weekdays and may require some on-call work. Work is performed primarily at the clinic, the residential site, and minimal time in the community. With traumatic brain injury, life changes in an instant. For us, there is no greater reward than easing human suffering and helping people put their lives back together. CNS helps people with brain injury find hope, independence, and return to a meaningful life - and you play a critical role in their journey. At CNS, we are a community of “Pathfinders” who work together to find every path possible for our patients to reach their maximum independence and quality of life. We create a supportive work environment through selflessness, innovation, and hard work. We take work very seriously, but we also enjoy a great atmosphere of fun and professional development, and we are committed to promoting a rich environment for each other to thrive through collaboration and empowerment. Please see our moving corporate video, "The Story of Centre for Neuro Skills" at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jwqve9gWtEw&feature=youtu.be Work is full time during the weekdays (7:30am - 4:30pm). BENEFITS Paid time off Extended sick leave Health/dental/life insurance starting the 1st of the month after hire Paid holidays, including a floating Personal Observance Day 401(k) JOB DUTIES AND REQUIREMENTS Develops and monitors individual behavior programs and data systems. Reports all such programs and/or changes to the Director of Behavior Programming, Director of Rehabilitation, Clinical Case Managers, and/or Behavior Program Coordinator. Consults with clinical and residential staff to receive input on the implementation and effectiveness of each program. Reviews behavior programs as required with clinical therapists and other relevant staff. Requires verbal ability to effectively express ideas and programs when speaking to patients, patients' families, and personnel. Reviews behavior data, module results and generates appropriate statistics. Requires ability to analyze data and calculate totals using calculator and/or computer. Distributes programs and program changes to appropriate personnel. Monitors behavior database to include new, updated information and discontinue irrelevant information. May require visual ability and fine motor manipulation to manage computer input. Provides discharge recommendations related to behavior. Provide training as needed to transition behavior programs to the home environment. Performs reporting procedures. Conducts clinic behavior staffings, training and programming as required. Makes rounds of clinic therapies, trains staff and reviews program implementation. Requires walking, standing, climbing stairs, and participation in program implementation activities such as physical exercises and cognitive skill exercises. Must have the ability to coordinate, participate in, lead, and teach such programs. SPECIAL SKILLS UTILIZED, EDUCATION LEVEL, TRAINING Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Behavior Analysis or related field of expertise. Board Certified Assistant Behavior Analyst or Board Certified Behavior Analyst preferred or eligibility for certification. Working knowledge of rehabilitative care required. Prior direct care experience working with the brain injury population of persons served is preferred. COVID vaccination with booster (when eligible) is required. Apply Now!

Collaborate with D&T and business partners to ensure business and stakeholders have the reporting that is needed to make informed business decisions. Partner with the leadership team to test hypotheses within the business and build a collaborative environment enabling use of data throughout our operations. Facilitates the maintenance and reporting of benchmarks and performance metrics and outcomes. Serves as an advisor and key support to the leadership team. Other duties may be assigned.
